introduction.title: Our Editorial Mission
content: At News Portal, we are committed to delivering accurate, fair, and trustworthy journalism that serves the public interest. These Editorial Guidelines set the standards for all content published on our platform.
Our mission is to inform, educate, and empower our readers with high-quality news and analysis. We hold ourselves to the highest standards of journalistic integrity, transparency, and accountability.

These guidelines apply to all contributors, including staff writers, freelancers, editors, and guest contributors. Adherence to these standards is mandatory and essential to maintaining the trust of our audience.

sections.title: Core Editorial Principles
content: Our editorial standards are built on the following fundamental principles:

subsections.title: 1. Accuracy
subsections.content: Accuracy is the foundation of everything we do. We strive to ensure that all facts, figures, names, dates, and quotations are correct. All information must be verified through credible sources before publication.
items: Verify all facts with at least two independent sources when possible
Cross-check data, statistics, and quotes for accuracy
Correct errors promptly and transparently
Clearly distinguish between facts and opinions
Use primary sources whenever possible

subsections.title: 2. Independence
subsections.content: We maintain editorial independence from commercial, political, and other external influences. Our editorial decisions are based solely on journalistic merit and public interest.
items: Reject pressure from advertisers, sponsors, or political entities
Maintain a clear separation between editorial and commercial content
Avoid conflicts of interest that could compromise objectivity
Disclose any potential conflicts of interest
Make independent editorial decisions free from external influence

subsections.title: 3. Fairness & Impartiality
subsections.content: We present news and information fairly, giving all relevant parties an opportunity to respond. We strive for balance and avoid bias in our reporting.
items: Present multiple perspectives on controversial issues
Give subjects of criticism the right to respond
Avoid language that shows bias or prejudice
Challenge all viewpoints with equal rigor
Acknowledge our own perspectives and limitations

subsections.title: 4. Transparency
subsections.content: We are open about our methods, sources, and any limitations in our reporting. Transparency builds trust with our audience.
items: Clearly label opinion pieces, analysis, and sponsored content
Disclose the basis of our reporting
Explain our methodology when appropriate
Identify anonymous sources as specifically as possible
Acknowledge when information cannot be independently verified

subsections.title: 5. Accountability
subsections.content: We take responsibility for our work and correct errors promptly and prominently. We welcome feedback and are open to constructive criticism.
items: Acknowledge and correct mistakes quickly
Respond to reader concerns and complaints
Maintain clear processes for corrections and complaints
Hold ourselves to the same standards we apply to others
Learn from errors and improve our practices

sections.title: Accuracy & Fact-Checking
content: Maintaining accuracy is our top priority. Every piece of content must undergo rigorous fact-checking before publication.

subsections.title: Verification Standards
items: Verify all factual claims with credible sources
Confirm the authenticity of documents, images, and videos
Check the spelling of names and accuracy of titles
Verify dates, locations, and numerical data
Cross-reference information across multiple sources
Contact primary sources for verification when possible

subsections.title: Source Credibility
subsections.content: Not all sources are equally reliable. Evaluate sources based on:
items: Expertise and authority in the subject matter
Track record of accuracy and reliability
Potential biases or conflicts of interest
Access to first-hand information
Transparency about their information sources

subsections.title: When Speed Matters
subsections.content: In breaking news situations, we balance speed with accuracy. If we cannot verify all details, we clearly state what is confirmed and what is not.
items: Publish what we know with appropriate caveats
Clearly label unverified information
Update stories as more information becomes available
Avoid speculation and rumor
Prioritize accuracy over being first

sections.title: Sources & Attribution
content: Proper sourcing and attribution are essential to credible journalism. We give credit where it's due and protect our sources when necessary.

subsections.title: On-the-Record Sources
subsections.content: We prefer named sources who can be held accountable for their statements. Information from on-the-record sources should be clearly attributed.
items: Identify sources by full name and relevant title/affiliation
Use direct quotes accurately without altering meaning
Provide context for who the source is and why they're relevant
Get permission before publishing someone's contact information

subsections.title: Anonymous Sources
subsections.content: We use anonymous sources only when the information is crucial to the story and cannot be obtained on the record. Anonymous sources must be approved by an editor.
items: Explain why anonymity was granted
Describe the source as specifically as possible without revealing identity
Verify information from anonymous sources with other sources
Never grant anonymity to someone making personal attacks
Honor promises of confidentiality

subsections.title: Attribution Standards
items: Always attribute information to its source
Use 'according to' or 'said' for clear attribution
Link to original sources when citing published material
Give credit to other news organizations when appropriate
Distinguish between what we witnessed and what we were told

sections.title: Writing Style & Language
content: Clear, concise, and engaging writing is essential to effective journalism. We write for a general audience while maintaining professional standards.

subsections.title: General Style Guidelines
items: Write in clear, simple language that readers can understand
Use active voice and strong verbs
Keep sentences and paragraphs short and focused
Define technical terms and jargon
Use proper grammar, punctuation, and spelling
Follow AP Style Guide unless otherwise specified
Avoid clich√©s and overused expressions
Be precise and specific rather than vague

subsections.title: Tone & Voice
subsections.content: Our tone is professional, authoritative, and accessible. We inform without talking down to our audience.
items: Maintain a neutral, professional tone in news articles
Use appropriate tone for different content types (news, opinion, features)
Avoid inflammatory or sensational language
Be respectful even when covering controversial topics
Show empathy when covering sensitive subjects

subsections.title: Headlines & Subheadings
items: Write clear, accurate headlines that reflect the story
Avoid clickbait or misleading headlines
Use strong, active verbs in headlines
Keep headlines concise (ideally 8-12 words)
Use subheadings to break up long articles
Ensure headlines can stand alone without context

sections.title: Story Structure & Format
content: Well-structured stories help readers find and understand information quickly. Different story types require different structures.

subsections.title: News Stories
subsections.content: Use the inverted pyramid structure: most important information first, followed by supporting details.
items: Lead with the most newsworthy information
Answer who, what, when, where, why, and how in the first paragraph
Present information in descending order of importance
Include context and background
End with less critical details

subsections.title: Feature Stories
subsections.content: Feature stories allow for more creative storytelling but still require strong structure.
items: Start with a compelling lead or anecdote
Establish the story's theme early
Use narrative techniques to engage readers
Include vivid details and quotes
Bring the story full circle in the conclusion

subsections.title: Article Length
items: Breaking news: 300-500 words
Standard news articles: 500-800 words
In-depth reports: 1,000-1,500 words
Feature stories: 1,200-2,000 words
Analysis pieces: 800-1,200 words

sections.title: Multimedia & Visual Content
content: Photos, videos, graphics, and other visual elements enhance storytelling and must meet the same standards as text.

subsections.title: Photography Standards
items: Use only authentic, unaltered photos (except basic corrections)
Never stage or manipulate news photos
Caption all photos with accurate information
Credit photographers appropriately
Obtain permission for photos of private individuals
Be sensitive when using graphic or disturbing images
Ensure photos are high quality and relevant to the story

subsections.title: Video & Audio
items: Clearly identify the source and date of video/audio
Do not edit video/audio in ways that misrepresent events
Provide transcripts or captions for accessibility
Verify the authenticity of user-generated content
Include trigger warnings for disturbing content

subsections.title: Graphics & Data Visualization
items: Ensure all data in graphics is accurate and sourced
Use clear, appropriate visualizations for the data
Avoid misleading scales or presentations
Make graphics accessible to colorblind readers
Cite data sources clearly

sections.title: Ethical Standards
content: Ethical journalism is the foundation of public trust. We adhere to the highest ethical standards in all our work.

subsections.title: Conflicts of Interest
subsections.content: We avoid conflicts of interest and disclose them when they cannot be avoided.
items: Do not cover stories where you have a personal or financial interest
Disclose any relationships with story subjects
Do not accept gifts, payments, or favors from sources
Avoid covering family members or close friends
Disclose previous employment or affiliations relevant to the story

subsections.title: Plagiarism & Copyright
subsections.content: We respect the work of others and never present someone else's work as our own.
items: Never copy text from other sources without attribution
Use proper quotation marks and attribution
Paraphrase appropriately while crediting original source
Obtain permission to use copyrighted material
Follow fair use guidelines
Report and remove plagiarized content immediately

subsections.title: Privacy & Consent
items: Respect individuals' privacy rights
Obtain consent before publishing personal information
Be especially careful with minors and vulnerable individuals
Consider the public interest when reporting private matters
Protect the identity of victims when appropriate
Do not publish information that could endanger someone

subsections.title: Sensitive Topics
subsections.content: When covering sensitive topics like crime, tragedy, or trauma, we balance public interest with compassion.
items: Show sensitivity when interviewing victims or grieving families
Avoid gratuitous details of violence or suffering
Consider the long-term impact of publishing identifying information
Provide context for disturbing content
Include resources for affected individuals (hotlines, support services)

sections.title: Corrections & Updates
content: Everyone makes mistakes. What matters is how we handle them. We correct errors quickly, clearly, and completely.

subsections.title: Correction Policy
items: Correct factual errors as soon as they are discovered
Note corrections clearly at the top or bottom of articles
Explain what was incorrect and what the correct information is
Do not silently edit errors without acknowledgment
Preserve the original error in the correction note for transparency
Notify readers who may have seen the incorrect version

subsections.title: Updates vs. Corrections
subsections.content: Updates add new information to a developing story. Corrections fix errors in previously published information.
items: Label updates clearly with date and time
Note significant changes to the story
Explain what new information was added
Update the article's timestamp appropriately

subsections.title: Major Errors
subsections.content: For significant errors that materially affect the story's meaning, we may need to republish or retract the article entirely.
items: Consult with editors on major corrections
Consider whether a new article is needed
In extreme cases, retract the article with full explanation
Learn from errors to prevent future mistakes

sections.title: Social Media & Online Conduct
content: Social media is an important tool for journalism and audience engagement, but it requires the same editorial standards as our published content.

subsections.title: Social Media Use
items: Verify information found on social media before reporting it
Clearly identify News Portal affiliation in social profiles
Maintain professional conduct on social media
Do not share unverified information or rumors
Be transparent about corrections on social media
Respect embargoes and confidential information
Avoid political advocacy or bias in personal posts

subsections.title: User-Generated Content
subsections.content: When using photos, videos, or information from social media or audience members:
items: Verify authenticity before using
Obtain permission from the creator
Credit the source appropriately
Be cautious of manipulated or misleading content
Consider privacy implications

subsections.title: Engagement Guidelines
items: Engage respectfully with readers and critics
Do not argue with or insult commenters
Report harassment or threats to appropriate authorities
Correct misinformation about our reporting
Be professional even when facing criticism

sections.title: Opinion & Analysis
content: Opinion and analysis pieces provide valuable perspective but must be clearly distinguished from news reporting.

subsections.title: Labeling
items: Clearly label all opinion pieces as 'Opinion' or 'Commentary'
Mark analysis pieces as 'Analysis' or 'Perspective'
Use visual indicators (labels, different layouts)
Ensure headlines indicate opinion/analysis content
Keep opinion content separate from news sections

subsections.title: Standards for Opinion
subsections.content: While opinion pieces express viewpoints, they still must be factually accurate and ethical.
items: Base opinions on accurate facts
Fact-check claims made in opinion pieces
Disclose relevant conflicts of interest
Avoid personal attacks or defamation
Present opposing viewpoints fairly
Maintain ethical and professional standards

subsections.title: Guest Contributors
items: Vet guest contributors for credibility and expertise
Disclose contributors' relevant affiliations and interests
Edit submissions for clarity and accuracy
Ensure guest posts meet editorial standards
Include a clear author bio with each contribution

sections.title: Sponsored & Commercial Content
content: We maintain a strict separation between editorial and commercial content. Sponsored content must be clearly labeled.

subsections.title: Disclosure Requirements
items: Clearly label all sponsored or paid content
Use prominent labels: 'Sponsored', 'Advertisement', 'Paid Content'
Visually distinguish sponsored content from editorial content
Disclose the sponsor prominently
Never disguise advertising as editorial content

subsections.title: Editorial Independence
items: Advertisers have no influence over editorial content
Editorial decisions are made independently
Do not promise coverage in exchange for advertising
Maintain separate teams for editorial and commercial content
Reject advertising that conflicts with editorial standards

subsections.title: Native Advertising
subsections.content: If we publish native advertising (sponsored content in editorial style), it must be clearly labeled and meet quality standards.
items: Use clear, unambiguous labels
Ensure content provides value to readers
Maintain factual accuracy in sponsored content
Do not allow misleading or deceptive sponsored content

sections.title: Diversity & Inclusion
content: We strive to represent the diversity of our community in our coverage and ensure all people are treated with dignity and respect.

subsections.title: Inclusive Coverage
items: Seek diverse sources and perspectives
Cover underrepresented communities fairly
Avoid stereotypes and generalizations
Be sensitive to cultural differences and traditions
Consider whose voices are missing from our stories

subsections.title: Inclusive Language
items: Use gender-neutral language when appropriate
Respect individuals' preferred pronouns
Use person-first language for disabilities when appropriate
Avoid ageist, racist, or discriminatory language
Be precise rather than using broad generalizations
Consult style guides on inclusive language

subsections.title: Cultural Sensitivity
items: Research cultural contexts before reporting
Consult with community members when covering their communities
Avoid cultural appropriation in language or imagery
Be aware of historical sensitivities
Acknowledge our own cultural perspectives and limitations

sections.title: Legal & Safety Considerations
content: We must be aware of legal issues and safety concerns in our reporting.

subsections.title: Defamation
items: Verify all potentially damaging allegations
Give subjects the opportunity to respond
Distinguish between facts and opinions
Avoid publishing false information that damages reputation
Consult legal counsel when necessary

subsections.title: Safety & Security
items: Prioritize journalist safety in dangerous situations
Assess risks before covering dangerous events
Protect sources who may face retaliation
Secure sensitive information appropriately
Consider the safety implications of what we publish

subsections.title: Legal Compliance
items: Comply with copyright and intellectual property laws
Respect privacy laws and regulations
Follow court reporting restrictions when applicable
Understand and comply with relevant media law
Consult legal counsel for complex legal issues

contact.title: Questions About These Guidelines?
content: If you have questions about these Editorial Guidelines or need clarification on any policy, please contact our editorial team:

commitment.title: Our Commitment
commitment.content: We are committed to maintaining the highest standards of journalism and continuously improving our practices. These guidelines are living documents that evolve with the industry and feedback from our community. We welcome your input on how we can better serve you.
